page.title: 06Bridgnorth By-Pass
page.content: The Bridgnorth by-pass was opened in 1985 by the Minister of Transport Mrs. Linda Chalker. Two of St. John's pupils held the tape for Mrs. Chalker to cut when the opening was performed. The road crosses the river and runs under the Severn Valley Railway taking traffic away from the congested centre of the historic town of Bridgnorth. Planned for nearly 50 years, the project was commenced in 1983 and finished 6 months ahead of schedule. The planners say that it will take a lot of north bound traffic away from the centre of Bridgnorth and help to preserve the ancient buildings which might otherwise suffer damage. The resident engineer was Sabah Shamash who moved from Swansea to supervise this project.
